title: Google\Cloud\LifeSciences\V2beta\PersistentDisk
name: PersistentDisk
description:
Configuration for a persistent disk to be attached to the VM.

See https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/disks/performance for more information about disk type, size, and performance considerations.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.lifesciences.v2beta.PersistentDisk

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.size_gb
params.description: The size, in GB, of the disk to attach. If the size is not specified, a default is chosen to ensure reasonable I/O performance. If the disk type is specified as local-ssd, multiple local drives are automatically combined to provide the requested size. Note, however, that each physical SSD is 375GB in size, and no more than 8 drives can be attached to a single instance.

params.name: data.type
params.description: The Compute Engine disk type. If unspecified, pd-standard is used.

params.name: data.source_image
params.description: An image to put on the disk before attaching it to the VM.

methods.description:
The size, in GB, of the disk to attach. If the size is not specified, a default is chosen to ensure reasonable I/O performance.

If the disk type is specified as local-ssd, multiple local drives are automatically combined to provide the requested size. Note, however, that each physical SSD is 375GB in size, and no more than 8 drives can be attached to a single instance.
